JOB DESCRIPTION

The Senior Android QA Automation Tester plays a vital role in ensuring the quality and reliability of Android applications through the design, development, and execution of advanced automated testing strategies. This position requires deep technical expertise in Android platforms and testing frameworks, along with strong collaboration skills to work effectively with developers, product managers, UX designers, and DevOps teams.

The ideal candidate will take ownership of the Android testing lifecycle, contribute to architecture decisions for test automation, and promote best practices such as Test-Driven Development (TDD) and Behavior-Driven Development (BDD). A strong focus on CI/CD integration, mobile-specific testing challenges (such as device fragmentation and performance), and continuous improvement is key.




Key Accountabilities:

Design, implement, and maintain scalable and reliable automated test frameworks for Android applications.

Develop and execute test plans, test cases, and test scripts for functional, regression, and performance testing.

Collaborate closely with Android developers and cross-functional teams to understand requirements and provide early feedback through automated testing.

Integrate automated tests within CI/CD pipelines

Drive mobile testing best practices, including testing on real devices and emulators, parallel execution, and handling OS-specific behaviours.

Advocate for quality across the development lifecycle by participating in code reviews, sprint planning, and release planning.

Troubleshoot and isolate complex issues, providing detailed documentation and feedback to development teams.

Mentor and guide junior QA engineers in test automation strategy and implementation.




Required skills and Experience

Professional level (6+ years’ experience) as an Automation QA with at least 4 years focused on Android mobile apps.

Proficiency in Kotlin and familiarity with Espresso, UI Automator, or other Android test automation frameworks.

Solid understanding of Android architecture, UI/UX patterns, and mobile testing challenges.

Strong knowledge of CI/CD systems and integration of automated tests into build pipelines.

Experience working with tools such as Appium, Firebase Test Lab, BrowserStack, or similar.

Familiarity with Agile/Scrum development processes.

Excellent problem-solving, communication, and collaboration skills.




Desired skills & experience

Previous experience in the payments industry or with PCI DSS compliance is advantageous.

Experience with performance, security, or accessibility testing on Android.

Knowledge of REST API testing tools such as Postman or REST-assured.

Exposure to cross-platform mobile testing (e.g., Flutter, React Native).

JOB DESCRIPTION

Job Title: Senior QA Automation Engineer (C#/.NET)




About the Role

We are looking for an experienced Senior QA Automation Engineer to join our Poland-based QA team and contribute to a long-term transformation program in the insurance and claims management domain. You will play a key role in shaping our test automation strategy, developing reliable test frameworks, and ensuring the delivery of high-quality software solutions.




Your responsibilities will include:

Designing, writing, and maintaining automated test scripts (API and UI) in C#.

Contributing to backend and frontend automation frameworks.

Performing manual testing where needed to ensure comprehensive coverage.

Executing and analyzing performance tests, reporting results to stakeholders.

Supporting user acceptance testing (UAT) by assisting end users.

Providing QA estimates during sprint planning and refinement sessions.

Coaching and mentoring other QA team members.

Actively collaborating in Scrum teams and improving QA processes.




Requirements:

5+ years of experience in software testing, including 3+ years in automation (API and UI).

Strong programming skills in C# with ability to write and review code (not only run scripts).

Solid knowledge of OOP principles, SOLID, and testing methodologies.

Hands-on experience in API testing (REST#), microservice architecture, and CRUD services.

Experience with automation tools such as Selenium, Xray, Visual Studio, Git, and Page Object Model.

Knowledge of SQL Server and T-SQL.

Previous experience working in Agile/Scrum teams with JIRA.

Strong analytical skills, attention to detail, and willingness to contribute to both automated and manual testing.

Excellent communication skills, with ability to collaborate effectively in distributed teams.




Nice to have:

UI automation experience.

Experience in performance testing.

Familiarity with Microsoft Azure or cloud-based platforms.




Tech Stack:

.NET / C#, API-centric test automation, UI automation, Git/version control.




What we offer:

Permanent, full-time engagement in a long-term international program.

Opportunity to work with modern technologies in a strategic transformation project.

Collaborative environment with both automation and manual testers.

Possibility to grow as an expert in cloud-based insurance systems.

JOB DESCRIPTION

Andersen is hiring a QA Automation Engineer (Python) for a project with a global mobile game developer. The role focuses on automating tests for a custom game engine to improve test coverage and development efficiency. 

 

The customer is a leading global developer and publisher of mobile games, operating across more than 50 countries. With a team of over 3,000 professionals, the company is recognized as one of the top three mobile gaming studios worldwide by revenue. Its portfolio includes several hit titles that consistently rank among the highest-grossing games in app stores, attracting over 100 million monthly active users. The customer emphasizes innovation, long-term player engagement, and high production quality. 

 

The project is focused on automating complex technical debt test cases related to a custom game engine, similar to Unity and written in C++. This engine is used for game development, and the automated testing aims to improve coverage and efficiency across key engine functionalities. 

 

Responsibilities: 

- Designing, developing, and maintaining automated test frameworks. 

- Writing and executing automated tests for web interfaces and API testing. 

- Refactoring existing tests to align with the new Page Object Model architecture. 

- Managing test results and documentation. 

- Integrating automated tests into CI/CD pipelines. 

- Collaborating with customer teams to ensure high-quality delivery and alignment with project requirements. 

 

Must-haves: 

- Experience in QA Automation for 3+ years. - Experience with invasive frameworks that provide access to models inside the editor. - Proficiency in Python and experience with Pytest. - Familiarity with QASE for test management.- Skills in using Teamcity and GitHub. - Experience in creating tests using PageObject and Factory patterns. - Knowledge of testing tools such as Selenium (for web testing) and API testing (via websocket). - Ability to work with APIs through websocket. - Exceptional communication and teamwork skills, focused on collaborative problem-solving. - Level of English – from Intermediate and above. 

 

Nice-to-haves: 

- Experience working as a lead or a desire to work as a lead of Andersen AQA team. - Experience or understanding of the testing process in gamedev industry. 

 

Reasons why this job would be interesting to you: 

- Experience in teamwork with leaders in FinTech, Healthcare, Retail, Telecom, and others. Andersen cooperates with such businesses as Samsung, Siemens, Johnson & Johnson, BNP Paribas, Ryanair, Mercedes, TUI, Verivox, Allianz, T-Systems, etc.

- The opportunity to change the project and/or develop expertise in an interesting business domain. 

- Job conditions – you can work both fully remotely and from the office or can choose a hybrid variant. 

- Guarantee of professional, financial, and career growth! The company has introduced systems of mentoring and adaptation for each new employee. 

- The opportunity to earn up to an additional 1,000 USD per month, depending on the level of expertise, which will be included in the annual bonus, by participating in the company's activities.   

- Access to the corporate training portal, where the entire knowledge base of the company is collected and which is constantly updated. 

- Bright corporate life (parties / pizza days / PlayStation / fruits / coffee / snacks / movies). 

- Certification compensation (AWS, PMP, etc). 

- Referral program. 

- English courses. 

- Private health insurance and compensation for sports activities. 

 

Your personal data is protected in accordance with GDPR regulations. Learn more: https://andersenlab.com/privacy-policy/pl

 

Join us!

JOB DESCRIPTION

Senior QA Automation Engineer – Data Migration Project

Do zespołu technologicznego pracującego nad greenfieldowym projektem migracji danych poszukujemy doświadczonego QA Automation Engineera. Projekt polega na zastąpieniu starszego systemu analitycznego nową platformą opartą o ClickHouse – skalowalną bazę danych zoptymalizowaną pod analizy czasu rzeczywistego. Zespół QA będzie dedykowany wyłącznie testom migracyjnym (dane, performance, zgodność), niezależnie od istniejącego QA dla głównej aplikacji.




Szukamy osób, które nie tylko dobrze odnajdują się w automatyzacji testów, ale także potrafią projektować frameworki testowe od zera, myślą analitycznie i dobrze rozumieją procesy ETL.




Zakres obowiązków:

Budowa frameworku testowego do weryfikacji jakości migracji danych (funkcjonalność, integralność, performance)

Pisanie testów automatycznych (API, BDD, performance)

Bliska współpraca z zespołem developerskim oraz analitykami danych

Praca z bazami danych (PostgreSQL, Spark SQL, ClickHouse)

Udział w codziennych stand-upach, planowaniu i przeglądach sprintów




Wymagania:

Minimum 8 lat doświadczenia zawodowego, w tym 5+ w automatyzacji

Bardzo dobra znajomość Java

Doświadczenie w: Cucumber (BDD), Postman, JMeter/LoadRunner, SQL, Azure DevOps

Umiejętność projektowania i wdrażania własnych frameworków testowych

Doświadczenie w środowiskach Agile/Scrum

Wysoka komunikatywność i samodzielność




Mile widziane:

Znajomość zagadnień z obszaru finansów (clearing, prime brokerage)

Doświadczenie w projektach greenfield, migracjach danych




📍 Lokalizacja: Warszawa (hybrydowo: 3 dni biuro / 2 dni zdalnie)

🕓 Start: ASAP lub do 1 miesiąca

💼 Forma współpracy: B2B

📅 Długość projektu: długoterminowy kontrakt

👥 Liczba wakatów: 2

JOB DESCRIPTION

Our customer is embarking on an exciting and challenging transformation program and our software solutions are a driving force behind this strategy to deliver cloud-based computing and leading-edge design and architecture to our business.

The Senior QA Tester Automation Engineer is a key member of our Quality team working on a variety of projects within a distributed scrum environment across EU

The Senior QA Tester Automation Engineer will work with the rest of the QA team to record and automate test scripts using C# and a range of toolsets and following the standards set out. 

The Senior QA Tester Automation Engineer will become an expert in our strategic technology platform, built in Microsoft Azure, servicing our regional and global client base within the Insurance industry.

Key Responsibilities: 

Writing automated test scripts to verify and validate that the new software meets the business needs

Gaining a strong understanding of the business operation

Recording and monitoring QA test results

Enhancing existing automation back end and front end framework 

Providing coaching support to others in the QA team

Providing QA effort estimates in work refinement sessions

Helping to drive the test automation strategy across the business

Running performance tests and ensuring that the results meet established levels

Assisting in the user acceptance test (UAT) process by helping end users understand how to use the software

Be an active member of the Scrum team, improving processes and ensuring that the team delivers on their commitment

Knowledge and Skills required:

5+ years of experience in testing (with at least 3 years in UI/API automation).

Sound knowledge and experience of Web Application testing including API testing using Rest #.

Knowledge of OOP, SOLID, and other principles

Experience in testing systems with a microservice architecture

Knowledge of how CRUD services work

Experience using C# language.

Experience with software QA processes, methodologies, and tools. 

Experience and desire to perform Manual testing

Sound knowledge of SQL server and TSQL, Visual Studio, Git, Selenium, Xray and Page Object Model.

Knowledge of current industry-wide quality & test processes, practices, tools and techniques.

Self-organizing problem solver with the ability to think outside the box.

Works effectively with both local and remote colleagues, collaborating, motivating, and energizing others.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills with strong attention to detail.

Continuously looking to improve and learn new technologies, participating actively in the development community, contributing to blogs, researching or Opensource.

Enjoys working in a fast-paced environment.

Experience required:

Previous experience working in medium-sized development teams.

Experience working in an agile environment employing scrum methodology and JIRA as a SDLC management tool.

JOB DESCRIPTION

About the role

We’re on a mission to redefine battlefield management for modern operations - and we need a quality-focused, self-driven QA Engineer to help us get there.

At our innovative startup, we’re building a next-gen Battlefield Management System that merges Android mobile apps (built with Flutter), a robust Java backend, and real-world hardware components like radios, sensors, and weather stations. Designed for use in high-risk environments, this platform must meet the highest standards for security, performance, and reliability - and that’s where you come in.

Requirements

4+ years in QA roles, with experience in both manual and automated testing.
Deep understanding of mobile testing best practices, especially for Android platforms.
Experience testing RESTful APIs and backend systems.
Solid grasp of Agile workflows and cross-functional collaboration.
Proven ability to work independently and proactively drive testing efforts.
Strong English communication skills (written & spoken).

Nice to have:

Experience with hardware integration (e.g., radios, sensors, weather stations).
Background in high-security, mission-critical, or military-grade software.
Knowledge of penetration testing and security best practices.

Responsibilities

As the QA Engineer, you’ll take end-to-end ownership of our testing lifecycle, covering both manual and automated testing across a complex ecosystem. You’ll work closely with developers, product managers, and domain experts to ensure our system performs flawlessly under pressure.

Your responsibilities will include:

Test Strategy & Execution: Design and maintain test plans, test cases, and test scenarios.
Functional & Technical Testing: Perform system, integration, regression, and security testing across mobile (Android), backend (Java), and hardware components.
Automation: Build and maintain automated test suites using tools like Appium, Flutter Driver, or Espresso.
Mobile Testing: Conduct hands-on testing across Android devices, ensuring cross-platform consistency.
API Testing: Validate RESTful APIs and ensure reliable communication between frontend and backend.
Performance Testing: Assess app responsiveness and stability under real-world conditions, including variable networks and hardware states.
Collaboration: Partner with developers and stakeholders in Agile ceremonies to ensure quality from design through delivery.
Scenario Writing: Author precise, real-world test cases reflecting both standard and edge-use scenarios.

JOB DESCRIPTION

Andersen is looking for a QA Automation Engineer (Java) for a project with an international banking group. The role focuses on testing digital banking solutions, mainly in the retail sector. 

 

The customer is a leading international banking group, operating for over four decades across the Middle East, North Africa, Europe, the Americas, and Asia. The organization provides a wide range of services, including corporate banking, trade finance, treasury solutions, Islamic banking, and retail banking, with physical branches in five countries and a fast-growing fully digital mobile bank. It is recognized for its commitment to digital transformation through dedicated innovation units and digital platforms, including a fully digital retail bank. 

 

The project is focused on enhancing digital banking channels and expanding online banking services. A key area of development is the retail segment, where the team will work on improving and delivering new digital solutions to enhance the customer experience and broaden the bank’s retail offerings. 

 

Responsibilities:  

- Developing and executing test scripts for products while identifying deficiencies. 

- Suggesting solutions to identified product problems. 

- Investigating product quality to implement improvements for enhanced customer satisfaction. 

- Collaborating with the Product Development team to ensure consistent project execution. 

- Identifying quality assurance process bottlenecks and proposing improvement actions. 

- Collecting quality data. 

- Determining key KPIs for product quality. 

- Preparing and presenting reports and metrics to Senior Management. 

- Coordinating with UAT teams to maintain consistent project execution. 

 

Must-haves: 

- Experience as a QA for 2+ years. 

- Experience with coding using Java. 

- Experience with software QA tools and processes. 

- Familiarity with continuous integration tools such as Jenkins. 

- Experience in using Jira and confluence. 

- Critical thinker and problem-solving skills. 

- Strong communication and documentation skills. 

- Ability to drive to goals and milestones while valuing and maintaining a strong attention to details. 

- Level of English – from Intermediate+ and above. 

 

Nice-to-haves: 

- Proficiency in scripting languages including Bash and Python. 

- Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.

JOB DESCRIPTION

QA Automation Engineer

100% REMOTE




KIM JESTEŚMY?




ALTEN – Światowy lider usług inżynieryjnych i IT

Grupa ALTEN, założona w 1988 roku we Francji, jest wiodącym partnerem technologicznym, obsługującym największych klientów na świecie. W 2023 roku osiągnęła przychody przekraczające 4,07 miliarda euro i zatrudnia ponad 57 000 pracowników, w tym 88% inżynierów i ekspertów IT. ALTEN Polska działa od 13 lat, wspierając innowacje, badania i rozwój oraz systemy IT swoich klientów. Posiada biura w Krakowie, Warszawie, Wrocławiu, Gdańsku i Poznaniu. Obsługuje kluczowe branże, takie jak lotnicza, kosmiczna, przemysłowa, motoryzacyjna, kolejowa, energetyczna, finansowa, telekomunikacyjna i sprzedażowa. Zakres ekspertyzy: analiza biznesowa, cyberbezpieczeństwo, sztuczna inteligencja, analiza danych i rozwiązania chmurowe, rozwój aplikacji, testowanie oprogramowania, zarządzanie projektami, oprogramowanie wbudowane, zarządzanie jakością, industrializacja, transformacja cyfrowa oraz inżynieria przemysłowa.

Więcej informacji na http://www.altenpolska.pl




Poszukiwany: QA Engineer (Test Automation) – Zespoły rozwojowo-utrzymaniowe




Do jednego z naszych projektów poszukujemy QA Engineera ze znajomością JavaScript/TypeScript oraz doświadczeniem w automatyzacji testów. Osoba na tym stanowisku będzie wspierać rozwój i utrzymanie produktu w zwinnej strukturze, w oparciu o pipeline CI/CD, zapewniając wysoką jakość dostarczanego oprogramowania.




KLUCZOWE ZADANIA:

Współtworzenie zespołu rozwijającego i utrzymującego produkt.

Zapewnienie jakości w procesie wytwórczym opartym o podejście zwinne i CI/CD.

Projektowanie, wdrażanie i utrzymywanie testów automatycznych (głównie regresyjnych).

Testowanie nowych funkcjonalności – automatycznie i manualnie – w dwutygodniowych sprintach.

Analiza pokrycia testami i identyfikacja luk w procesach QA.

Badanie i debugowanie defektów.




WYMAGANIA:

Min. 3 lata doświadczenia w automatyzacji testów.

Bardzo dobra znajomość JavaScript/TypeScript.

Doświadczenie z przynajmniej jednym frameworkiem testowym: Playwright (preferowany), Selenium, Appium, WebdriverIO, TestNG.

Znajomość narzędzi do zarządzania testami: JIRA, GitLab, Xray.

Umiejętność debugowania i analizy błędów testów automatycznych.

Znajomość Git oraz doświadczenie w testach funkcjonalnych i niefunkcjonalnych.

Znajomość języka angielskiego na poziomie umożliwiającym pracę z dokumentacją.

Znajomość Postmana i testowania API.




CO MOŻEMY CI ZAOFEROWAĆ?




DNA ALTEN łączy w sobie ludzkie wartości, kulturę doskonałości i doświadczenie w służbie swoim klientom. Oferujemy indywidualne podejście do każdego pracownika w duchu work-life balance. Kładziemy nacisk na odpowiedzialny, zrównoważony rozwój i proekologiczne rozwiązania.




Oferujemy:

▪ Umowę na pełen etat z możliwością wyboru formy zatrudnienia (UoP/B2B)

▪ Udział w konferencjach branżowych, szkoleniach i warsztatach oraz spotkaniach integracyjnych

▪ Możliwość odbycia kursów i zdobycia certyfikacji

▪ Możliwość relokacji w ramach lokalnych oddziałów ALTEN Polska




BENEFITY

▪ Prywatna opieka medyczna Medicover

▪ Prywatna opieka dentystyczna Medicover

▪ Platforma zakupowa Medicover Benefits / karta sportowa Medicover

▪ Program poleceń pracowników ALTEN Talenty

▪ Wyprawka dla nowonarodzonego dziecka pracownika

▪ Ubezpieczenie grupowe na życie

▪ Możliwość udziału w programie emerytalnym




Dołącz do naszego zespołu i razem z nami twórz przyszłość technologii już dziś!




Klikając w przycisk „Wyślij” zgadzasz się na przetwarzanie przez Alten Polska sp. z o.o. z siedzibą w Warszawie Twoich danych osobowych zawartych w zgłoszeniu rekrutacyjnym w celu prowadzenia rekrutacji na stanowisko wskazane w ogłoszeniu.

W każdym momencie możesz cofnąć zgodę, kontaktując się z nami pod adresem ALTEN_PL_RODO@alten.com, co oznacza zakończenie rekrutacji i nieuwzględnienie Twojej kandydatury przy przyszłych rekrutacjach.




Pełną informację odnośnie przetwarzania Twoich danych osobowych znajdziesz https://docs.altenpolska.pl/do_pobrania/Klauzula_informacyjna_dla_potencjalnych_pracownikow.pdf

JOB DESCRIPTION

AgileEngine is an Inc. 5000 company that creates award-winning software for Fortune 500 brands and trailblazing startups across 17+ industries. We rank among the leaders in areas like application development and AI/ML, and our people-first culture has earned us multiple Best Place to Work awards.




Why join us

If you're looking for a place to grow, make an impact, and work with people who care, we'd love to meet you! :)




About the role

We’re looking for a QA Automation Engineer to join a digital platform that’s transforming land and livestock management. You’ll contribute to both new feature development and ongoing support, working with a modern tech stack (JavaScript/TypeScript, React, Mapbox, MUI) and collaborating with a skilled Scrum team.




This role is a chance to make a real impact by delivering value to end-users, shaping testing strategies, and driving innovation in a product that promotes sustainability and smarter farm management.







What you will do




Plan, write, review, and execute test plans throughout the development life cycle;

Ensure test plans thoroughly cover all requirements and use cases;

Develop automated tests for the most important test suites and set up those under CI/CD;

Actively participate in the scrum team events;

Foster a continuous improvement approach to QA activities;

Manual testing, especially when there are no automation tests yet.




Must haves




4+ years of commercial experience in automation testing using JavaScript/TypeScript;

Experience with end-to-end testing using Cypress/similar tool;

Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines;

Strong communication skills with excellent interpersonal effectiveness;

Upper-Intermediate English Level.




Nice to haves




Experience working with Azure DevOps and Azure DevOps Boards.




The benefits of joining us




Professional growth

Accelerate your professional journey with mentorship, TechTalks, and personalized growth roadmaps




Competitive compensation

We match your ever-growing skills, talent, and contributions with competitive USD-based compensation and budgets for education, fitness, and team activities




A selection of exciting projects

Join projects with modern solutions development and top-tier clients that include Fortune 500 enterprises and leading product brands




Flextime

Tailor your schedule for an optimal work-life balance, by having the options of working from home and going to the office – whatever makes you the happiest and most productive.







Meet Our Recruitment Process




Asynchronous stage – An automated, self-paced track that helps us move faster and give you quicker feedback:

Short online form to confirm basic requirements

30–60 minute skills assessment

5-minute introduction video




Synchronous stage – Live interviews

Technical interview with our engineering team (scheduled at your convenience)

Final interview with your future teammates




If it’s a match — you’ll get an offer!

JOB DESCRIPTION

At Fun Crafters, we're not just another gaming company; we're a passionate community of gaming enthusiasts and innovators with over a decade of expertise in crafting engaging mobile games. With a mission to create unforgettable gaming experiences, we've carved our path in the gaming industry. 

Join us to unleash your creativity, shape the future of mobile gaming, and be part of a team where your ideas matter. 

Welcome to a world where fun knows no bounds!




As a QA Automation Engineer focused on Test Development, you will focus on development and maintaining automated tests for our Unity games on Android and iOS platforms. You will work closely with our development and QA teams to ensure the quality and reliability of our products through strong test automation solutions.







Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and maintain automated test scripts for Unity Mobile Games on Android and iOS platforms.
Contribute to the architecture and implementation of our end-to-end testing framework.
Execute and scale automated test suites utilizing the device farms (remote and/or in-house).
Analyze the automated test reports to identify the application issues and provide a feedback regarding the product quality.
Collaborate with senior team members to evaluate and integrate appropriate technologies for enhancing our test automation capabilities and optimizing our Quality Assurance workflow.
Stay up to date with industry trends and best practices in automated testing and game development to continuously improve our processes and infrastructure







Professional Requirements:

Proven experience in designing, developing, and maintaining the Test Automation scenarios (extra points if this was done in the Gaming Industry).
Proficiency in Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) languages such as C#, Python, or Java, with a focus on test automation.
Experience with test automation tools and frameworks (such as AltTester, Appium, Unity Test Framework, Selenium Grid)
Experience with one or more cloud based testing platforms and services (such as AWS Device Farm, BrowserStack, SauceLabs or similar)
Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work efficiently in a fast paced team environment.
Experience with the Unity Engine is a plus.







What we offer:

An epic journey in the mobile RPG gaming industry.
Flexible contract options: employment or B2B.
Remote, in-office, or hybrid work.
Opportunities for professional growth with a training budget.
A fantastic team and many company events.
Competitive benefits package.
A modern office with all the essentials.

JOB DESCRIPTION

Do zespołu rozwijającego oprogramowanie dla jednego z największych operatorów sieci automatów paczkowych w Europie, z którego rozwiązań korzystają każdego dnia miliony użytkowników poszukujemy Senior QA Automation Engineera, który wesprze nas w tworzeniu nowoczesnych, skalowalnych i odpornych na awarie systemów działających w środowisku chmurowym. 




Szukamy osoby z solidnym doświadczeniem w budowie i testowaniu aplikacji cloudnative, otwartej na nowe technologie i narzędzia, która dobrze odnajduje się w pracy w międzynarodowym, interdyscyplinarnym zespole. Pracujemy z dużymi wolumenami danych, wykorzystując do tego Apache Kafka.




Twój zakres obowiązków:

Projektowanie, implementacja i utrzymanie testów automatycznych (backend i frontend).

Automatyzacja testów REST API.

Udział w procesie CI/CD (Jenkins, Github).

Raportowanie błędów, przygotowywanie dokumentacji testowej.

Wdrażanie dobrych praktyk w zakresie automatyzacji i jakości oprogramowania.




Nasze wymagania:

Minimum 7 lat doświadczenia doświadczenia w automatyzacji testów (Java).

Bardzo dobra znajomość Selenium, RestAssured, Cucumber.

Doświadczenie w testowaniu API (REST).

Znajomość narzędzi CI/CD (Jenkins, Github).

Praktyczna znajomość pracy z Kafka.

Umiejętność pracy w zespole, komunikatywność, samodzielność




Mile widziane: 

Doświadczenie z narzędziami do monitoringu/logowania (np. Grafana, Kibana).

Znajomość Dockera.




Stack technologiczny w projekcie: Java, Selenium, Cucumber, REST API, Rest Assured, Kafka, Jenkins, Github




Model pracy: 100 % zdalnie, z gotowością do okazjonalnych wyjazdów służbowych.




Godziny pracy: polskie godziny biurowe, preferowane 8:00-16:00/9:00-17:00




Czas trwania projektu: Projekt długoterminowy.




Proces rekrutacji:

Rozmowa techniczna z elementami live-codingu (90 minut).

HR Interview z Managerem po stronie klienta (30 minut).




Euvic - ponad 5000 pracowników i 20 lat doświadczenia niewątpliwie czynią nas dużą firmą. A jednak, mimo upływu czasu i stale powiększającego się grona klientów wciąż jesteśmy firmą stworzoną przez inżynierów IT dla inżynierów IT. Tworzymy prężnie rozwijającą się firmę „z ludzką twarzą”, składającą się z dobrych ludzi, tworzących dobre oprogramowanie. Czyni nas to solidnym partnerem IT skupiających się na własnych osiągnięciach, sukcesach klientów i satysfakcji zawodowej pracowników.

 

Co oferujemy?

sprawny, szybki i przyjazny proces rekrutacyjny (nie tylko umiejętności są dla nas ważne, wspólnie sprawdźmy, czy pasujesz do the Good People),

pracę i rozwój w renomowanej firmie IT, z ugruntowaną pozycją na rynku,

projekty dla klientów międzynarodowych z wielu branż,

płaską strukturę, politykę „otwartych drzwi” i dbałości o dobre relacje w zespołach,

małe zespoły w dużej firmie i koleżeńską wspólnotę w tych zespołach,

transparentny i atrakcyjny program szkoleniowy oparty na badaniach kompetencji,

bonusowy program poleceń,

wsparcie buddiego w okresie onboardingu,

rozwój wewnątrz organizacji – szkolenia wewnętrzne, „Euvic Talks”, możliwość prowadzenia wewnętrznych szkoleń,

udział w inicjatywach społecznych – wspieramy potrzebujących z udziałem Fundacji The Good People.

 

W Euvic tworzymy środowisko pracy oparte na równości, szacunku i otwartości. Wierzymy, że różnorodność talentów i perspektyw napędza innowacje oraz wspiera zrównoważony rozwój. Dlatego nasze procesy rekrutacyjne są projektowane w sposób, który zapewnia każdemu kandydatowi równe szanse, niezależnie od pochodzenia, płci, wieku, orientacji seksualnej, stanu zdrowia czy innych indywidualnych cech. Dążymy do budowania kultury pracy, w której każdy może rozwijać swój potencjał i czuć się w pełni akceptowany.

 

Zastanawiasz się czy warto?

 

W naszym wewnętrznym badaniu #theGoodPeople wskazali 4 kluczowe aspekty, które cenią najbardziej:

Sam/a decyduję o tym, jak najlepiej wykonać swoją pracę.

Mój manager/ka jest dostępny, otwarty na sugestie i odmienność zdania.

Jestem traktowany/a z należytym szacunkiem.

W moim zespole panuje atmosfera sprzyjająca współpracy.

 

Brzmi jak dobre miejsce pracy dla Ciebie?

 

Wybierz swoje benefity:

System kafeteryjny (karta Multisport, bilety na wydarzenia sportowe i muzyczne oraz wiele, wiele więcej),

Opieka medyczna,

Ubezpieczenie na życie z możliwością wykupienia dodatkowych pakietów np. opieki onkologicznej,

Inicjatywy rozwojowe.

 

Zapraszamy do #theGoodPeople - profesjonaliści, pasjonaci, dobrzy ludzie 🙂

JOB DESCRIPTION

Everything is possible with the right people

In4ge jest firmą rekrutacyjną, w której wierzymy, że wszystko jest możliwe dzięki odpowiednim ludziom. Naszym celem jest połączenie najbardziej utalentowanych pracowników z odpowiednimi firmami, tworząc synergiczne relacje, które przyczyniają się do wzrostu i sukcesu każdej ze stron. Uważamy, że prawdziwą wartość stanowią ludzie pracujący wspólnie w atmosferze wzajemnego szacunku i zaufania.







Aktualnie poszukujemy doświadczonych Testerów Automatyzujących (QA Automation Engineers), którzy chcą dołączyć do ambitnego projektu związanego z technologią Blockchain. Jeśli masz silne kompetencje w Pythonie i lubisz pracę w nowoczesnych, rozproszonych zespołach – ta oferta jest dla Ciebie!




Zakres roli:

Tworzenie, rozwijanie i utrzymywanie testów automatycznych dla aplikacji opartych na technologii Blockchain
Projektowanie scenariuszy testowych w oparciu o wymagania biznesowe i techniczne
Integracja testów z pipeline’ami CI/CD
Współpraca z zespołami deweloperskimi i DevOps przy identyfikacji oraz rozwiązywaniu błędów
Analiza wyników testów i raportowanie jakości oprogramowania
Udział w procesie ciągłego doskonalenia narzędzi i praktyk QA w projekcie




Oczekujemy:

Kilkuletniego doświadczenia w automatyzacji testów, najlepiej w środowiskach złożonych i nowoczesnych
Bardzo dobrej znajomości Pythona i umiejętności pracy z narzędziami do testowania (np. Pytest, unittest lub inne)
Praktycznej wiedzy lub wcześniejszego udziału w projektach opartych na technologii Blockchain
Umiejętności pracy w zespole rozproszonym – komunikatywność i samodzielność są dla nas kluczowe
Znajomości narzędzi CI/CD i podstaw integracji testów z pipeline’ami
Proaktywnego podejścia do rozwiązywania problemów i dbania o jakość na każdym etapie




Proponujemy:

Rozwój kariery w międzynarodowych projektach, z wykorzystaniem nowoczesnych narzędzi i technologii.
Elastyczny model pracy: możliwość 100% zdalnie lub hybrydowo z biura.
Atrakcyjne wynagrodzenie dopasowane do Twoich umiejętności i doświadczenia.
Współpracę w zgranym zespole, który ceni wymianę wiedzy oraz otwartą komunikację.
Realny wpływ na projekty oraz wdrażane rozwiązania.




💡Nie przegap dopasowanych ofert!

Mamy wiele rekrutacji, a nowe projekty pojawiają się na bieżąco. Pamiętaj, że zaznaczając zgodę na przetwarzanie danych w celu przyszłych procesów, będziemy mogli zaprosić Cię do udziału w kolejnych procesach, dopasowanych do Twojego doświadczenia i oczekiwań!

PS Zamierzamy kontaktować się z Tobą wyłącznie wtedy, kiedy będziemy dla Ciebie ciekawe projekty, bez tej zgody nie będzie to możliwe.




Jak wygląda proces rekrutacyjny in4ge?

Nasz proces rekrutacyjny jest transparentny i skoncentrowany na znalezieniu odpowiedniego kandydata dla naszych klientów. Składając aplikację, możesz liczyć na nasz obiektywizm, szacunek i pełny profesjonalizm.

Czekamy na Twoje CV.




We connect you with the right people

JOB DESCRIPTION

About the client:


Vorwerk is a globally recognized brand known for its high-quality household products such as Thermomix and Kobold. With innovation at its core, Vorwerk combines cutting-edge technology and user-centric design to create products that improve everyday life.


Project Description:


Join an agile development team focused on building and maintaining test automation using Qt Squish and Robot Framework.Your main responsibility will be to create, run, and debug automated test cases to support high-quality product delivery. As part of the Scrum team, you will participate in daily meetings, sprint planning, reviews, and retrospectives. All technical tasks are pulled from the backlog and executed independently, with strategic guidance provided by the service provider


Responsibilities:


Develop and maintain automated test cases using Qt Squish and/or Robot Framework

Debug and analyze test results

Actively contribute to Agile/Scrum ceremonies

Collaborate with developers and QA team members to ensure test coverage

Independently manage and pull tasks from the scrum backlog


Requirements:


Experience with Python

Strong hands-on experience with Qt Squish and/or Robot Framework

Solid understanding of Qt6

Experience working in Agile environments

Ability to work independently and manage prioritie

Strong attention to detail and quality


We offer*:

Flexible working format - remote, office-based or flexible

A competitive salary and good compensation package

Personalized career growth

Professional development tools (mentorship program, tech talks and trainings, centers of excellence, and more)

Active tech communities with regular knowledge sharing

Education reimbursement

Memorable anniversary presents

Corporate events and team buildings

Other location-specific benefits

*not applicable for freelancers

JOB DESCRIPTION

Obowiązki:

Automatyzacja testów w Pythonie przy użyciu popularnych frameworków testowych, takich jak PyTest, Unittest czy Selenium.
Implementacja i zarządzanie procesami CI/CD, w tym automatyzacja buildów, testów i wdrożeń za pomocą narzędzi takich jak Jenkins, GitLab CI, CircleCI.
Tworzenie i utrzymywanie skryptów automatycznych do testów regresyjnych, funkcjonalnych oraz wydajnościowych.
Współpraca z zespołem deweloperskim w celu zapewnienia wysokiej jakości kodu i ciągłego doskonalenia procesów testowych.
Przeprowadzanie analiz wyników testów, raportowanie błędów i sugerowanie usprawnień.
Wdrażanie najlepszych praktyk QA w procesie tworzenia oprogramowania, aby zapewnić ciągłą jakość na każdym etapie rozwoju.







Oczekiwania:

Masz minimum 5 lat doświadczenia w automatyzacji testów w języku Python. Znasz i potrafisz stosować popularne frameworki testowe, takie jak PyTest, Unittest, Selenium czy Appium.
Potrafisz tworzyć testy zarówno dla aplikacji webowych, jak i backendowych.
Masz solidną wiedzę na temat CI/CD i praktycznego zastosowania narzędzi takich jak Jenkins, GitLab do automatyzacji procesów buildów, testów i wdrożeń.
Wiesz, jak efektywnie integrować procesy testowe w pipeline’y CI/CD, aby zwiększyć szybkość i niezawodność procesu dostarczania oprogramowania.
Potrafisz przeprowadzać testy zarówno funkcjonalne, jak i regresyjne dla aplikacji webowych i API, używając narzędzi takich jak Postman, SoapUI oraz frameworków testowych w Pythonie.
Potrafisz analizować wyniki testów, szukać przyczyn błędów i sugerować poprawki.
Umiesz tworzyć czytelne raporty z wynikami testów oraz proponować usprawnienia w procesie QA.
Język angielski na poziomie B2+ – komunikacja z międzynarodowym zespołem i dokumentacja techniczna w tym języku.

Umiejętność projektowania planów, scenariuszy i przypadków testowych.

Szukamy osoby, która:

Myśli analitycznie i potrafi samodzielnie rozwiązywać problemy

Lubi dzielić się wiedzą i współpracować w zespole

Jest zaangażowana, otwarta, komunikatywna – i ma poczucie humoru 😊

Position Summary:

We’re seeking a detail-oriented and seasoned Senior QA Engineer to lead both manual and automated testing initiatives across our suite of products. In this key role, you’ll help ensure our global medical device software is dependable, secure, and intuitive for end users.




Key Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and maintain comprehensive test strategies, plans, and reusable test cases.

Build and oversee automated testing frameworks to support continuous integration and deployment.

Solid understanding of the software development lifecycle and Agile methodologies.

Skilled in API testing using tools like Postman and SoapUI, and performance testing tools such as JMeter or Gatling.

Strong SQL skills for validating data integrity.

Familiarity with security and compliance testing standards (e.g., OWASP, GDPR).

Excellent problem-solving, documentation, and communication abilities.

Fluent in both written and spoken English.

Comfortable collaborating across time zones, particularly with teams in Pakistan and the United States.

At Cognizant, we are dedicated to helping the world's leading companies build stronger businesses — helping them go from doing digital to being digital. You can expect five-star training, a chance to realize your career goals, and a range of benefits. Be Cognizant!




We're looking for a talented QA Engineer with strong Java skills to join our team. At Cognizant, we're dedicated to helping leading companies transition to being digital, and this role is crucial to that mission. We need someone who is passionate about ensuring the highest quality of software, has a solid background in Java development or automation, and is eager to contribute to impactful projects. Own, drive and improve of testing process within a development team following Agile methodology

Share knowledge and know-how inside and outside the team

Bug prevention and fail-fast mindset

About the Role




We are looking for a QA Engineer to join our cross-functional Agile team and ensure the delivery of high-quality software across web and mobile platforms.In this role, you’ll work closely with developers, product owners, and other QAs to execute manual and automated tests, create test cases, and contribute to test automation development (Playwright/Python).You’ll also get hands-on experience with modern AI-powered QA tools, helping to optimize test case generation, defect analysis, and regression suite maintenance.







Your Responsibilities

Execute manual and automated tests across web and mobile applications.

Design, maintain, and improve automated test scripts in Playwright/Python.

Create, update, and execute test cases based on business and technical requirements.

Perform API testing (Postman), including automated API test execution.

Collaborate with developers and product teams in an Agile/Scrum environment.

Support CI/CD testing processes (GitLab CI).

Report and track defects using Jira and ensure proper documentation in Confluence.

Participate in the introduction and daily use of AI testing tools (e.g., for test creation, defect analysis).Contribute to improving QA processes and sharing knowledge with the team.







Requirements




Must have:

+4 years of experience in software testing in commercial projects.

Hands-on experience in both manual and automated testing.

Good knowledge of Playwright and Python for test automation.

Solid API testing experience with Postman (manual & automated).

Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines (GitLab CI preferred).

Experience with test case management tools.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

Good time management and ability to work independently on assigned tasks.

Fluent communication skills in English (spoken & written).

Nice to have:

Experience testing mobile applications (real devices or device farms).

Knowledge of Agile/Scrum methodologies.

ISTQB Foundation or Advanced certification.

Experience with performance and/or security testing.

Exposure to AI/ML testing tools (e.g., intelligent test creation).







Our Tech & QA Stack

Languages/Frameworks: PHP 8+/Symfony 6+/Laravel 9+, JS/TypeScript, Go, PHPUnit, Codeception, Flutter/Dart

Databases: MySQL, MariaDB

Infrastructure: UNIX, Kubernetes, RabbitMQ

Testing: Playwright, Python, Dart, Postman

CI/CD: GitLab CI, Code Magic 

Containerization: Docker

AI Tools: Jetbrains AI, Cursor, Gemini for Google Workspace

Tools: Jira, Requirements & Test Management for Jira, Confluence, Slack, IDE (freedom of choice),  G Suite, Sentry 







Engineering Culture

JOB DESCRIPTION

About the Role




We are seeking a QA Lead to take full ownership of our Quality Assurance processes across multiple development teams and play a significant role in one of our projects. This role blends strategic leadership, hands-on test execution, and AI-driven QA innovation. You'll be responsible for developing scalable QA strategies, introducing modern automation and AI tools, and ensuring delivery of high-quality products across web and mobile platforms.




If you have a solid background in QA leadership, deep technical expertise (especially in Playwright/Python), and a vision for how AI can elevate QA practices, we’d love to meet you.







Your Responsibilities

Lead and evolve the QA strategy in collaboration with tech and product leadership.

Implement AI-powered test case generation, defect analysis, and automated regression suite optimization

Drive end-to-end testing activities: strategy, planning, execution, automation, reporting, and release readiness.

Mentor and guide QA engineers while maintaining hands-on involvement in project testing. Collaborate with cross-functional Agile teams to integrate QA seamlessly into the development lifecycle.

Build automated test frameworks from scratch and continuously improve existing ones (Playwright/Python).

Define test cases based on technical and business requirements.

Support CI/CD processes and ensure high-quality automated pipelines (GitLab CI).

Ensure visibility of QA metrics and quality KPIs (i.e., test coverage, defect leakage, and release quality) across all levels of the organization.

Work independently, managing priorities and deadlines.

Advocate for a quality-first mindset within the organization.







Requirements




Must have

Proven experience in large-scale software projects, with at least 8+ years of experience in software testing.

Strong background in both manual and automated testing.

Track record of mentoring QA engineers and building high-performing QA teams.

Excellent communication skills and a proactive approach to problem-solving and process improvement.

Ability to balance strategic thinking with a hands-on approach.

Expertise in Playwright and Python-based test automation.

Advanced API testing (Postman) experience: design, security,  execution, and automation.

Experience in setting up and maintaining automated test pipelines from scratch (GitLab CI preferred).

Experience with test case management and reporting tools.

High proficiency in time management, analytics, and independent decision-making.

Fluent communication skills in English, both written and spoken.




Nice to Have

Experience testing mobile applications (real devices or device farms).

Familiarity with Agile/Scrum and eXtreme Programming practices.

ISTQB Advanced/Expert level certification.

Basic German language skills.

Experience with performance and security testing. 

Exposure to AI/ML tools for testing (e.g., intelligent test creation, test impact analysis, anomaly detection).







Our Tech & QA Stack

Languages/Frameworks: PHP 8+/Symfony 6+/Laravel 9+, JS/TypeScript, Go, PHPUnit, Codeception, Flutter/Dart

Databases: MySQL, MariaDB

Infrastructure: UNIX, Kubernetes, RabbitMQ

Testing: Playwright/Python, Dart, Postman

CI/CD: GitLab CI, Code Magic 

Containerization: Docker

AI Tools: Jetbrains AI, Cursor, Gemini for Google Workspace

Tools: Jira, Requirements & Test Management for Jira, Confluence, Slack, IDE (freedom of choice),  G Suite, Sentry 







Engineering Culture

Agile Scrum + XP elements

OOP, TDD, DDD, SOLID, Clean Code

Code reviews, pull requests, automation mindset

QA as part of cross-functional team







What We Offer

A key leadership role with real impact on product and process quality.

Opportunity to introduce and work with cutting-edge AI testing solutions.

Collaborative, inclusive, and innovative work culture.

Competitive salary and benefits.

JOB DESCRIPTION

For our client we are looking for Digital & Web Analytics Consultant / Developer - Location: Poland (working EST US hours)

A leading organization is seeking 2–4 experienced consultants to support its expanding digital marketing and analytics operations. The selected vendor will work closely with the internal analytics team and take ownership of web analytics tracking implementations—primarily via Adobe Launch—as part of a migration to Adobe Customer Journey Analytics. The role also includes managing third-party vendor tags and delivering actionable reporting in Adobe and Tableau.




🎯 Project Scope & Responsibilities:

Assist demand generation teams with reporting and third-party tracking across platforms such as Google, Facebook, LinkedIn, and Epsilon.

Implement and maintain Adobe CJA and Analytics scripts, variables, and integrations using Adobe Launch.

Rapidly onboard and integrate new ad-tech and MarTech vendors (e.g., 6sense, Adobe Target).

Build and maintain dashboards and reports in Adobe Analytics, Adobe CJA, and Tableau.

Ensure data accuracy and integrity through QA processes, automation scripts, and outage detection.

Conduct full QA cycles including UAT, data validation, and reporting verification.

Perform ad-hoc analyses using Adobe CJA, Snowflake, Tableau, and related tools.

Maintain integration with OneTrust to ensure analytics tags are deployed only after proper visitor consent.

Advise on GDPR and privacy best practices to ensure ongoing compliance.

Collaborate within Agile teams and communicate effectively across technical and non-technical stakeholders.




✅ Required Qualifications:

Minimum 5 years of experience in large-scale web analytics using tools such as Adobe CJA, Adobe Analytics, Launch, Target, GA, GTM, Tealium, and Snowplow.

Proven experience migrating from Adobe Analytics to Adobe CJA and transitioning from app measurement to Web SDK.

Familiarity with major advertising platforms: Google, Facebook, LinkedIn, Epsilon.

Strong skills in dashboard/report creation in Adobe and Tableau.

Experience with hit-level and customer-level data analysis.

Hands-on experience with Event Driven DataLayer development.

Experience with consent-based tag deployment (OneTrust).

Proficiency in JavaScript, HTML/CSS, Python, SQL.

Understanding of cookies, server calls, link tracking, identity management.

Ability to work independently across all phases of analytics implementation.

Strong communication and project management skills.

💡 Preferred Skills:

Experience with automation scripting/testing for data accuracy and outage monitoring.

Advanced analytics/reporting pipeline development using JavaScript, SQL, Python.




What we offer:

Contract: B2B directly with US company

Salary: up to 160 pln/h

100% remote

Location: Poland (working EST US hours)

Contract Duration: 12 months

About the Project

Currently we are looking for Senior Test Automation Engineer with experience in Java who will join team working on projects from logistics industry. You will play a key role in developing and maintaining robust test scripts and strategies across a range of systems and components.

  

Work Mode: remote

 

 




Job Responsibilities

Create, maintain, and improve automated tests for both component-level and end-to-end system testing

Collaborate closely with developers, QA teams, and product owners to ensure complete and effective test coverage

Leverage a Gherkin-based testing framework to design and run automated test cases

Develop and support testing strategies for data pipelines built on Kafka, verifying data integrity, message transformations, and enrichment processes

Design and implement test scenarios for Java Spring Boot microservices, with emphasis on performance, scalability, and system reliability

Diagnose and resolve issues in test environments and scripts to support continuous integration and testing

Actively contribute to Agile ceremonies including sprint planning, reviews, and retrospectives

Provide guidance and mentorship to junior QA and automation engineers, promoting a culture of quality and continuous improvement




Expectations

Min. 5 years of hands-on experience in test automation, including both component-level and end-to-end system testing

Strong proficiency in Java for building and maintaining automated test scripts and frameworks

Practical experience with BDD tools such as Cucumber, SpecFlow, or equivalents, using Gherkin syntax for test definitions

In-depth understanding of Kafka-based systems, including message queues, topics, producers, and consumers

Proven ability to test Java Spring Boot microservices and RESTful APIs

Familiarity with automation tools like Playwright, RestAssured, or similar

Experience working with CI/CD platforms such as Jenkins, GitLab CI, or others

Solid working knowledge of both SQL and NoSQL databases to support data validation and integrity checks

Knowledge of containerization and orchestration (preferable Kubernetes)

Familiarity with monitoring and logging tools like Prometheus and Grafana

Prior experience in Agile/Scrum environments

English on an advanced level (written and spoken)




We Offer

Ongoing support from a dedicated agent, taking care of your project continuity, client contact, necessary formalities, work comfort and development, 

Consultant Development Program – advice on growth planning based on the latest trends and market needs in IT, including consultations with agents and growth mentors, 

Access to 7N Learning & Development – a development and educational platform with webinars, a library of articles and industry reports, and regular invitations to one-time and recurring development events – technical, business, and lifestyle, 

Spectacular integration events, both for you (e.g., annual Kick-Off trip, Christmas parties, or Summer Olympics sports events) and for your loved ones (e.g., family picnics, movie premieres), 

Professional development not only during the project – you can get involved in knowledge transfer to others within the 7N Services offering directed at 7N clients, 

Relationships and access to the knowledge of the most experienced IT experts in the market – the average professional tenure of our consultants in Poland is over 10 years, 

A complete benefits package, including funding for medical care, life insurance, sports cards for you and your loved ones, as well as discounts in stores in Poland and abroad. 




About 7N

Constantly searching for projects, difficult rate negotiations, lack of development support – sounds familiar? At 7N, you gain not only stability of contracts but also the personal involvement of a dedicated agent who ensures your professional comfort and continuous access to development initiatives. 

Our mission is to provide stable and rewarding collaborations that drive your success as an IT expert and the success of our clients. We build long-lasting relationships based on Scandinavian values and 30 years of experience creating IT solutions for over 200 organizations.

JOB DESCRIPTION

About the Role




We are looking for an experienced Senior PHP Developer to join our cross-functional engineering team and contribute to building scalable, secure, and high-performance web applications. You will work on projects using PHP 8+, Symfony, and microservices architecture, collaborating closely with DevOps, QA, and Product Owners.




If you are passionate about clean, maintainable code, enjoy modernizing legacy systems, and love solving complex technical challenges in a collaborative Agile environment, we’d love to meet you.







Your Responsibilities

Design, develop, and maintain web applications using PHP 8+, Symfony, and Laravel.

Write clean, maintainable, and testable code, following OOP, SOLID, TDD, DDD, and Clean Code principles.

Lead and participate in refactoring and replatforming initiatives for legacy applications, ensuring long-term maintainability and performance.

Collaborate with architects, product managers, DevOps, and QA engineers to deliver features from concept to deployment.

Build and integrate REST APIs with security, scalability, and performance in mind.

Troubleshoot, debug, and resolve technical issues across the stack.

Write and maintain unit, functional, and integration tests (PHPUnit, Codeception).

Participate in code reviews and contribute to improving our engineering standards.

Maintain and update technical documentation.







Requirements




Must Have

5+ years of commercial experience in PHP web development.

Strong experience with PHP 8+, at least one of the popular MVC frameworks (Symfony/Laravel/Yii), DDD, Microservices Architecture, and REST API.

Solid knowledge of OOP, SOLID, and Clean Code principles.

Proven experience in refactoring and replatforming large-scale legacy systems.

Hands-on experience with MySQL/MariaDB databases.

Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines (GitLab CI preferred).

Experience with Docker and Git.

Strong understanding of software architecture and system design.

Effective communication skills and ability to work in a team.

Proactivity and a strong focus on continuous improvement.

Languages: Fluent in English (B2) and Polish (B2).




Nice to Have

Experience with front-end technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript/TypeScript).

Experience with Agile/Scrum and eXtreme Programming.

Experience with queue systems

Knowledge of German language.







Our Tech & QA Stack

Languages/Frameworks: PHP 8+/Symfony 6+/Laravel 9+, JS/TypeScript, Go, PHPUnit, Codeception, Flutter/Dart

Databases: MySQL, MariaDB

Infrastructure: UNIX, Kubernetes, RabbitMQ

Testing: Playwright, Python, Dart, Postman

CI/CD: GitLab CI, Code Magic 

Containerization: Docker

AI Tools: Jetbrains AI, Cursor, Gemini for Google Workspace

Tools: Jira, Requirements & Test Management for Jira, Confluence, Slack, IDE (freedom of choice),  G Suite, Sentry 







Engineering Culture

Agile Scrum + XP elements

OOP, TDD, DDD, SOLID, Clean Code

Code reviews, pull requests, automation mindset

QA as part of cross-functional team







Benefits and Perks

Private healthcare

Cafeteria system & Sport Card

Training budget €800 per year

Integration meetings (internal training, hackathon, integration trips and meetings)

Referral Bonus

Startup atmosphere

No dress code

Flexible hours

Flexible working format - remote or hybrid 

Modern office, Chillout zone, Standing desk, parking for bicycles, and a cloakroom with showers

Regular office lunches and integration meetings

Some international travels included







Why Join Us?

You’ll work on impactful, high-traffic projects in a collaborative environment where your voice matters.We value quality, innovation, and continuous learning—giving you the space to grow as a developer and contribute to building products that truly make a difference.

Lead and guide QA team members from our third-party development agency.

Create, use, and update an automated testing plan to make sure the product is reliable.

Team player, communicative, with strong sense of responsibility.

JOB DESCRIPTION

🚀 Join Our Team: TAM Database Engineer – GTM Infrastructure

Help us build the most advanced outbound growth database in healthcare.

We’re hiring a TAM Database Engineer to power the core infrastructure behind our next-generation GTM engine. You’ll be at the center of a strategic company initiative to build a centralized, real-time TAM database of independent healthcare practices and billing companies, powering both AI- and human-led outbound workflows.




🧠  Core Responsibilities

1. Database Architecture & Ingestion

Design and manage scalable data pipelines to ingest large-scale datasets from web scraping (e.g., Healthgrades, Vitals,) and APIs (e.g., NPPES, Google Places, BuiltWith) into Snowflake or similar.

Implement deduplication, field-level validation, and audit logs to ensure high data quality and reliability.

Develop change tracking and delta snapshot tables to support scoring evolution and longitudinal analytics.

2.API & Platform Integrations

Build and maintain bi-directional integrations across our GTM tech stack:Inputs: Clay, ZoomInfo, CMS, public registriesOutputs: Outreach, SFDC, Marketo, Instantly, Slack

Orchestrate near real-time updates (<15 minutes) from source to sequence using event-based syncs and monitoring dashboards.

3. Clay-Snowflake Sync Enablement

Collaborate with GTM Engineering to enable dynamic enrichment and outbound activation logic in Clay using Snowflake-driven scoring and field logic.

Own the technical execution of Clay re-enrichment loops, field mapping QA, and sync health automation.

4. Operational Automation & Monitoring

Automate data maintenance workflows (re-enrichments, suppression logic, enrichment freshness SLA triggers).

Build Slack alerts and Looker/Tableau dashboards for sync failures, campaign gaps, and enrichment completeness.




💼  Outcomes You’ll Drive

A fully functional TAM database used as a system of record by Marketing, Sales, and RevOps.Faster and smarter outbound campaigns through reliable enrichment, scoring, and activation layers.

Increased pipeline conversion by enabling precise segmentation, trigger-to-channel routing, and campaign personalization.




✅ You Might Be a Fit If You Have

Proven experience with Snowflake, data warehousing, and ETL tools.

Comfort scraping structured data at scale using Apify, SerpAPI, or custom Puppeteer pipelines.

Familiarity with GTM systems: Clay, Outreach, Salesforce, Marketo, ZoomInfo, Instantly.

A product mindset: you value clean schemas, data governance, and proactive debugging.

Experience supporting GTM, RevOps, or Marketing teams is a plus (even better if you’ve done it in SaaS or healthcare).

Some exposure or interest in AI/NLP applications and how they interact with GTM systems.




🌍 About Mozaiq

Mozaiq is a fully remote team with roots in the US and Eastern Europe. We build powerful, cross-functional teams that support some of the most sophisticated tech and marketing organizations in the world.

🌐 Global Family: A tight-knit, multicultural, remote-first team

💼 Meaningful Work: Support world-class brands and products

🤝 Inclusive Culture: We prioritize collaboration, clarity, and growth




✨ Contractor Benefits

Flexible hours (with limited CET–US overlap)

Competitive hourly pay

Exposure to global clients and leading tech brands

100% remote work

JOB DESCRIPTION

Obowiązki

• Opracowywanie i wdrażanie scenariuszy testowych dla aplikacji webowych i mobilnych.

• Tworzenie, utrzymanie oraz optymalizacja testów automatycznych.

• Pisanie i uruchamianie testów.

• Przeprowadzanie testów integracyjnych i eksploracyjnych, w tym testów REST API.

• Analiza wyników testów, raportowanie błędów i udział w procesie ich weryfikacji/poprawy.

• Praca z bazami danych SQL w celu walidacji danych i wsparcia testów funkcjonalnych.

• Współpraca z zespołami deweloperskimi, analitykami i product ownerami, by zapewnić najwyższą jakość wytwarzanego oprogramowania.

• Dokumentowanie procesów testowych i dzielenie się wiedzą w zespole.




Wymagania

• Wykształcenie wyższe (preferowane kierunki związane z informatyką, matematyką lub pokrewne).

• Minimum 4 lata doświadczenia w obszarze testów automatycznych.

• Praktyczna znajomość przynajmniej jednego z narzędzi: Selenium, Cucumber, Cypress, Playwright, Robot Framework, Testim, Appium.

• Umiejętność programowania lub pisania skryptów w dowolnym języku programowania.

• Doświadczenie w pracy z bazami danych SQL (pisanie zapytań, walidacja danych).

• Znajomość testowania i automatyzacji REST API.

• Analityczne myślenie i dokładność w podejściu do testów i raportowania błędów.

• Bardzo dobra znajomość języka angielskiego i niemieckiego.

Job Description:




We are looking for an experienced Automation Tester to join our team and take responsibility for developing and maintaining automated tests. The person in this role will collaborate with developers, analysts, and other testers to ensure the highest quality of our products.




Responsibilities:




Enhance processes related to product quality assurance.
Collaborate with the Product team to communicate test outcomes and highlight potential risks.
Evaluate story requirements and technical designs, acting as a QA gatekeeper to provide constructive feedback.
Identify, report, and prioritize defects.
Design test cases and develop automation strategies.
Create, execute, and maintain E2E automated tests
Conduct manual regression testing.




Requirements:




Great German language skills.
Highly analytical thinking.
Self-starter personality.
Experience with general QA practices.
Experience with web application testing (including some HTML and CSS knowledge).
Experience with creating E2E tests in Java
Experience with creating test scenarios.
Experience with functional and regression tests.
(optional) Experience with performance testing.
